intro: Boisduvalia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered boisduvalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, delicate leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Boisduvalia parviflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
